intro: Hieracium leptophyton subsp. wotschense, commonly known as the Wotschensk hieracium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodland edges, preferring partial shade to full sun. Its leaves are lanceolate, with rough textures, and its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. This subspecies is noted for its distinct morphology and ecological niche within its native habitat.
